PictureNodeArray.Title: Supply pod
PictureNodeArray.Description: <jinse>Supply pods</> sent by Hykros to every shelter that are often robbed by Ravagers. Unlocking supply pods can obtain abundant resources as well as increase <jinse>exploration progress</> for the area.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Black nucleus
PictureNodeArray.Description: <jinse>Black nucleus</> is a rare material that can be traded to <jinse>Agnes</> in the shelter for items.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Exploration
PictureNodeArray.Description: Aida is a planet full of unsolved mysteriesâ€”some are artificial, and some are naturally formed. Solve them to obtain <jinse>black nuclei</>.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Training Facilities
PictureNodeArray.Description: Mysterious installations scattered throughout the world. Supposedly, they are <jinse>training</> devices from before the Cataclysm. Must be activated at a <jinse>specific time</>.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Dandelion
PictureNodeArray.Description: Dandelion with black nucleus inside. <jinse>Strike</> the seed to get the black nucleus.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Kerosenia
PictureNodeArray.Description: A common herb rooted in underground petroleum veins. It is said good stuff hides beneath the oil stored in the plant.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Chowchow
PictureNodeArray.Description: Strange plants that love to consume <jinse>water cores</> and supposedly regurgitate.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Thornvine
PictureNodeArray.Description: Thornvines that wrap around treasure. Can be set on <jinse>fire</>.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Omnium pillar induction plate
PictureNodeArray.Description: Stone <jinse>Omnium pillar</> induction plate. Activate it and see what happens.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Singularity Rock
PictureNodeArray.Description: Odd rocks that can be unearthed and levitated by <jinse>certain Relics</>. Often buried with other mysteries.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Force Induction Plate
PictureNodeArray.Description: Stone force induction plate activated by intense <jinse>downward impact</>. Activate it and see what happens.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Black Nucleus Drone
PictureNodeArray.Description: A drone carrying black nucleus. <jinse>Knock it down</> and get the black nucleus it's hauling.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Spliced metal box
PictureNodeArray.Description: Metal box with special surface pattern. <jinse>Splice</> with a corresponding box to get hidden treasure.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Glowshroom
PictureNodeArray.Description: Resilient mushroom cluster that <jinse>lights up</> when stomped. Rumor has it that good things happen when you light them up in <jinse>certain order</>.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Earthphyte
PictureNodeArray.Description: Plant in a variety of colors. Find buds with <jinse>matching colors</> and put them in the <jinse>center</> to get black nucleus.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Tar Pit
PictureNodeArray.Description: Cave full of solid <jinse>flammable</> petroleum blocks. Who knows what else is inside.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Lava Pit
PictureNodeArray.Description: A common natural phenomenon. Most of the self-replenished lava comes from deep underground and originated from decaying molten magma and radioactive substances.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Concentration Ray
PictureNodeArray.Description: The energy-gathered ray can gather and convert nearby <jinse>fissure</> energy into nucleus. Find this device and deliver the energy to activate the shattered rift.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Abandoned Truck
PictureNodeArray.Description: A freight truck for Banges abandoned after a Ravager assault, but the sturdy gate protected the cargo. Decode the password using the <jinse>encryptodroid</> next to the vehicle.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Energy Screen
PictureNodeArray.Description: This is a special defensive measure, requiring the right password to turn it on. The <jinse>encryptodroids</> around it seem to have logged the very mean.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Ruins
PictureNodeArray.Description: <jinse>Ruins</> left over from the Cataclysm, containing abundant <jinse>Relic materials</> as well as unknown danger.

PictureNodeArray.Title: The Hungry Little Critter
PictureNodeArray.Description: The small animal seems to want some food... Perhaps feeding it with the corresponding food can obtain something decent in return?

PictureNodeArray.Title: The Friendly Little Critter
PictureNodeArray.Description: The very friendly small animal looks like it is not afraid of strangers at all... Perhaps interacting with it can obtain something decent in return?

PictureNodeArray.Title: Elemental Supply Pod
PictureNodeArray.Description: Supply pods wrapped in elemental membranes require specific elemental attacks to unlock.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Ruin Stones
PictureNodeArray.Description: The ruin stones in Vera have marks remaining on them, and they appear to fit together when viewed at a certain angle.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Ruin Stones
PictureNodeArray.Description: The ruin stones in Vera have marks remaining on them, and they appear to fit together when viewed at a certain angle.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Hyena thug
PictureNodeArray.Description: The lowest level of enforcers for the Hyenas. Weak yet brutal.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Hyena sniper
PictureNodeArray.Description: Archer watchmen for the Hyenas, shooting arrows they either scavenged or robbed.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Hyena Wino
PictureNodeArray.Description: Perpetually drunk arsonists. Even fellow Hyenas keep them at arm's length.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Hyena destroyer
PictureNodeArray.Description: Mad bombers of the Hyenas gang. Love to blow up enemies, sometimes themselves too, with homemade explosives.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Freak Aberrant
PictureNodeArray.Description: Low-level aberrant who implode after losing control of their emotions. No resistance whatsoever against cold.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Sandworm
PictureNodeArray.Description: Humongous aberrant sandworms that wandered the dunes for food. Very apprehensive of flame attacks.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Water Core
PictureNodeArray.Description: Mechanical lifeform born of Omnium. Comprised mainly of water, thus easily destroyed by high voltage.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Flame core
PictureNodeArray.Description: Mechanical lifeform born of Omnium. Practically a ball of fire and conspicuously susceptible in low-temperature environments.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Volt core
PictureNodeArray.Description: Mechanical lifeform born of Omnium. Practically a sphere of electricity and becomes unstable when exposed to fire.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Frost core
PictureNodeArray.Description: Mechanical lifeform born of Omnium. Practically a ball of ice that does not stand up to high temperature at all.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Razor warrior
PictureNodeArray.Description: Iconic giant scissors, big enough to intimidate newcomers to the wasteland.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Headhunters
PictureNodeArray.Description: Enthusiastic thugs for the Hyenas, famous for their bouncing style of fighting.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Assault armor: Blade
PictureNodeArray.Description: When mad dwarves meet fiery armors... Only low temperature can cool off their desire to destroy.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Assault armor: Saw
PictureNodeArray.Description: Calm its roaring blistering sparks with low temperature.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Ironwings archer
PictureNodeArray.Description: Able to hit enemies with precision using aim-assistance eyepatch, but still miss sometimes.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Ironwings lancer
PictureNodeArray.Description: Spearmen with aerial combat ability. They should improve your luck significantly.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Overpower Mauler
PictureNodeArray.Description: Tremendous raw power keeps him as the top enforcer. Watch out for his maul.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Overpower Pitcher
PictureNodeArray.Description: Rock, baseball, bomb, even crumpled paper... You never know what's in his garbage bin until it hits you on the head.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Clone
PictureNodeArray.Description: Originally security droids made by Banges, now modified to project frost attack.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Ace Beater
PictureNodeArray.Description: The heavy hitter for Heirs of Aida, can obliterate a mob easily with tremendous firepower. Try freeze him if you must fight him.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Chainsaw Butcher
PictureNodeArray.Description: Compared to the roar of the saw, the vapid smile is even more intimidating.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Shroomen
PictureNodeArray.Description: A fungus-based lifeform that evolved due to Omnium. Peaceful by day, violent by night. It's afraid of fire just like ordinary flora.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Dynastinae
PictureNodeArray.Description: Battle droids manufactured by Banges. A leakage design flaw actually gave them electrical attacks.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Melee Shock Armor
PictureNodeArray.Description: The Ravagers' newest mech. Slower, bigger, and very high-maintenance, though lasting twice as long as Hyena mechs.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Aberrant
PictureNodeArray.Description: Normal people-turned-aberrants by Omnium radiation.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Ravager Flyer
PictureNodeArray.Description: Ravager aerial troop. Adequately equipped, a shame they're just mediocre fighter.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Ravager Assaulter
PictureNodeArray.Description: Ravager ground troop, a legion of brutes with remarkable hand-to-hand fighting abilities.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Omnium Guard
PictureNodeArray.Description: Weaponized mechs powered by Omnium. Plain but known for performance and high cost.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Aidan zealot
PictureNodeArray.Description: Warriors secretly cloned and trained by the Heirs of Aida. Combat is their sole purpose.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Aidan sniper
PictureNodeArray.Description: Gunners secretly cloned and trained by the Heirs of Aida. Bullseye sharpshooters.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Infernal Steel Lizard
PictureNodeArray.Description: Experimental subject that escaped from a destroyed lab. Its DNA sequence has been modified, no one knows what this creature was originally. Very little is known about it, except it's savage and highly aggressive.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Steelspine
PictureNodeArray.Description: Originally a wild beast aberrated by Omnium, only to become more ferocious after cyber modification. The metal shell made it invulnerable.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Predator
PictureNodeArray.Description: Guardbot from the Old Federation era that malfunctioned and lost all recognition capabilities after the Omnium Shock. The backside antenna can stun targets with intense flashes, so dodge if you can.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Needlebee
PictureNodeArray.Description: Giant killer bees aberrated by Omnium. Not resistant against cold.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Bat
PictureNodeArray.Description: The red glows in their eyes indicate their thirst for blood. Incinerate them with fire.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Aberrant goliath
PictureNodeArray.Description: Nothing is screaming in the head except: Fight! Rip them apart!

PictureNodeArray.Title: Bunnydart
PictureNodeArray.Description: Hard scale coupled with a pair of sharp claws give it the courage to fight humans, yet still can't overcome its fear of fire.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Wraith
PictureNodeArray.Description: Hyenas who dressed up in sorcerer costumes. Fearful of lightning, the staves in their hands are merely metal sticks.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Assassin
PictureNodeArray.Description: Nimble assassin for the Hyenas, carrying a dagger that discharges high voltage, but may malfunction in low-temperature environment.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Ronin
PictureNodeArray.Description: Wander the world with nothing but the blade.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Beaters
PictureNodeArray.Description: A fashionable thug gang within the Hyenas, carrying a heat-charged baseball bat that easily explodes when hit by cold air.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Sweeper
PictureNodeArray.Description: Every bit as powerful and terrifying as looked, befitting the "Sweeper" moniker. Cold is its only weakness.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Cyberrhino
PictureNodeArray.Description: Bioengineered by the Hyenas for mining and transportation purposes. Excellent stamina, but the cyberware limited its offensive maneuverability.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Scorpion
PictureNodeArray.Description: Watch out for the venomous sting!

PictureNodeArray.Title: Ceparat
PictureNodeArray.Description: Cunning and agile rodents. Shotgun is probably the best way to deal with these critters.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Night Lizard
PictureNodeArray.Description: Speckled lizard easily frightened by electricity.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Monkey Alpha
PictureNodeArray.Description: A bizarre creature covered in head-like appendages all over the body. Shies away from fire to preserve its lovely hair.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Harlequin: Red Scorpion
PictureNodeArray.Description: The Ravager faction that no one should ever underestimate. They fight just as well as men, and their unpredictability secured their spot as one of the most powerful groups in the Ravagers.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Spider Harlequins
PictureNodeArray.Description: The Ravager faction that no one should ever underestimate. They fight just as well as men, and their unpredictability secured their spot as one of the most powerful groups in the Ravagers.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Aberrant Canine Alpha
PictureNodeArray.Description: Experimental subject that escaped an unknown lab many years ago and miraculously survived the Cataclysm. It still couldn't avoid the effects of Omnium, which caused crystallizations to form on its body.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Wolf
PictureNodeArray.Description: Commonly sighted wolves like to move in packs. Just like most beasts, they don't like fire.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Dog Trainer
PictureNodeArray.Description: The dog trainers in the Ravagers proved that, with proper techniques, even aberrant canines could be domesticated.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Explopyder
PictureNodeArray.Description: Self-exploding spiders developed by the Ravagers. Tiny and hardly noticeable, thus always a big problem.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Windblade
PictureNodeArray.Description: Elite fighter from Heirs of Aida, nicknamed Windblade. Master of electrified double blade.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Hyena Gunner
PictureNodeArray.Description: Hyena members who voluntarily replaced their left arm with an EM blaster.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Biostriker
PictureNodeArray.Description: Volunteered for Heirs of Aida modification, highly aggressive with formidable combat skills. A top fighter in the organization.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Wild boar
PictureNodeArray.Description: Vicious boar, highly aggressive, but nevertheless still hunted down for food.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Bear
PictureNodeArray.Description: The ferocious beast Wanderers would least want to meet. Powerful paws can shatter bones easily.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Abnormal Aberrant
PictureNodeArray.Description: Beings affected by Omnium radiation. Resistant to extreme temperatures, though tissues showed no obvious enhancement.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Giant Aberrant
PictureNodeArray.Description: Beings with abnormally large physique. Resistant to conventional attacks, but fire is a known way to deal with them effectively.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Spiny eel
PictureNodeArray.Description: Gorgers that arrived on Aida through the dimensional passage opened accidentally by a probe. Nimble, highly aggressive, release spikes that drain the target's lifeforce. Very resilient, seemingly killable only through special, drastic means.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Earthcaller
PictureNodeArray.Description: Gorgers that arrived on Aida through the dimensional passage opened accidentally by a probe. Emit energy pluses from their vocal sacs as their primary attack. Very resilient, seemingly killable only through special, drastic means.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Aberrant Franken
PictureNodeArray.Description: Big aberrant that underwent forced modifications. Very dangerous when rampaged. The metal parts on its body made it susceptible to electricity.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Minotaur
PictureNodeArray.Description: Aberrant warrior with some intelligence. Proficient with shields. Hesitant when faced with frost attacks.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Interdimensional Frostfire Dragon
PictureNodeArray.Description: Steel dragon lurking in a certain ruin. Its awesome destructive power is a testament to Old Federation technology.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Robarg
PictureNodeArray.Description: Plantlike humanoid lifeform created through unknown means. Inherited the tenacity of plants, but also the innate fear of fire.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Hyenatron
PictureNodeArray.Description: A notorious killing machine for the Hyenas. Frost weapons are the choice when confronting this embodiment of fiery aggression.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Vulcan
PictureNodeArray.Description: Mad man who forsakes hair in favor of arson. Perfectly comfortable in high heat but susceptible to cold.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Chiron the Centaur
PictureNodeArray.Description: A combat machine cloaked in green lightning. High temperature can do bad things to the high-energy battery inside it.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Seraph
PictureNodeArray.Description: Rumors indicate it's one of the mechs from an unknown ruin. Not even pre-Cataclysm technology fits its profile. The only known fact is it's not as resistant to water.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Abyssant: Puppet Singer
PictureNodeArray.Description: The Puppet Singer is a creature taken over by the Abyssant. It has a strong urge to mimic human behavior. It is very agile.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Apophis
PictureNodeArray.Description: Allegedly a cyber creature that escaped from a lab. Huge and completely irrational. The fear of cold is programmed into it, perhaps done as a measure to control the behemoth.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Sobek
PictureNodeArray.Description: Ferocious beast lurking in the Crown swamp with an unknown past. It can breathe frost but does not stand up to electricity well.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Magma
PictureNodeArray.Description: The Magma is the original form of the Sobek found in Aesperia. It exhibits a bigger size and resides on top of the food chain in the Vera Desert.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Greenbird
PictureNodeArray.Description: The researcher referenced her pet when designing the shape, possibly in memory of something. It must be noted that Greenbird is a dead ringer for her pet, especially in aggressiveness and temperament.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Frost Bot
PictureNodeArray.Description: As if referencing certain dish, it was unexpectedly given a freeze feature, and its frame is vulnerable to fire.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Commander Habaka
PictureNodeArray.Description: Powerful aberrant created through bioaberration drugs. Lost all semblance of humanity and reason. Extreme cold should put it down quickly.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Frigg
PictureNodeArray.Description: One of the Angels of Clemency created by Heirs of Aida, designated as Number 2. A towering, efficient walking humanoid weapon.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Lucia
PictureNodeArray.Description: Veritable queen of the Hyenas in the Crown region. The stiletto heels and the chainsaw in her hands are equally devastating.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Nemesis
PictureNodeArray.Description: The unrecognizable appearance, the psychotic mind... Can all this really make Shirli happy? Electrical interference can perhaps short out some of the circuits and ease her pain.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Theo
PictureNodeArray.Description: His father made him into a cyborg, but did he ever have a say in that? Now, the electrical buzzing when he goes berserk is the only reply.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Aegis
PictureNodeArray.Description: One of the Angels of Clemency created by Heirs of Aida, designated as Number 3. Able to control multiple nimble cybernetic arms. Very few can withstand her multi-angle attacks.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Barbarossa
PictureNodeArray.Description: Originally a beast raised by someone, it escaped by accident and aberrated through Omnium exposure. Shreds all prey before it mercilessly. Its roar is a nightmare to many.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Seele
PictureNodeArray.Description: One of the Angels of Clemency created by Heirs of Aida, designated as Number 4. Petite but incredibly explosive, riding in a large machine equipped with cyberweapons, whose control is linked to Seele's consciousness.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Pallas
PictureNodeArray.Description: One of the Ravager bosses and in pursuit of Lady Sweetie's affections. He will do anything for his "sweetie" in return, even getting a tattoo to show his love. Obviously, messing with someone in infatuation isn't a wise thing to do... but Pallas's feelings seem to be one-sided?

PictureNodeArray.Title: Apostle Nemesis
PictureNodeArray.Description: Her system was hacked and subsequently controlled by Sage. The person who fought alongside me is now a ruthless, cold war machine. It's hard to fight her, but I have no choice...

PictureNodeArray.Title: Valkyrie
PictureNodeArray.Description: Valkyrie, the Number 1 that other Angels of Clemency spoke of, has a mysterious past just like them. But more conspicuously, she always acts alone, and seems more interested in toying with opponents than straight up fighting them. She's rather flippant with words, which drew criticisms from Frigg.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Show Mouse
PictureNodeArray.Description: Hold left Alt key to show and move the mouse

MediaNode.Title: Discharge Attack
MediaNode.Description: When your <jinse>weapon charge</> is full during combat, <jinse>switching weapons</> will trigger a discharge attack.

MediaNode.Title: Phantasia
MediaNode.Description: <jinse>Dodge</> before an incoming attack hits to trigger Phantasia and fully recharge the weapon's Omnium. <jinse>Switch weapon</> to activate the discharge attack.

MediaNode.Title: Missile Barrage
MediaNode.Description: Missile Barrage can blast open <jinse>broken walls</> and hit <jinse>dynamite drums</>.

MediaNode.Title: Jetpack
MediaNode.Description: <jinse>Hold</> the Jetpack <jinse>and drag</> it to change its direction before releasing and allowing it to dash towards the arrow's direction.

MediaNode.Title: Omnium Handcannon
MediaNode.Description: <jinse>Hold to aim</>. Fires an Omnium mechromancy cannon that absorbs surrounding energy upon landing and then transforms into a physical <jinse>pillar</>, which can be <jinse>climbed</> by the Wanderer.

MediaNode.Title: Jetboard
MediaNode.Description: Using the Jetboard allows you to travel along <jinse>rivers</> and go <jinse>down slopes</> quickly.

WidgetNode.Title: Frosted Spear
WidgetNode.Description: A common weapon among residents of Warren Snowfield. Infused with frost to reflect the local flavor. It's very popular, because it's cheap yet highly effective.

WidgetNode.Title: Combat Blade
WidgetNode.Description: A basic weapon developed by Banges Tech. Forged in a special alloy, it is light, agile, and easy to handle.

WidgetNode.Title: Nightingale's Feather
WidgetNode.Description: Blends perfectly into the gloomy night.

WidgetNode.Title: Staff of Scars
WidgetNode.Description: A mechanical staff with a cross rune carved into it. Capable of both forgiving sins or unleashing punishments.

WidgetNode.Title: The Terminator
WidgetNode.Description: The most gnarly firearm ever created, also known as a moving turret.

WidgetNode.Title: Pummeler
WidgetNode.Description: No one wants to be on the receiving end of this maul.

WidgetNode.Title: Composite Bow
WidgetNode.Description: A common weapon used by hunters in the snowfield. Easy to handle with very high accuracy. After enough promotion, it has earned more than half of the affordable civilian market.

WidgetNode.Title: Rosy Edge
WidgetNode.Description: An elegant frost blade that conjures up images of a pure white flower blooming on a snow-covered cliff.

WidgetNode.Title: Absolute Zero
WidgetNode.Description: Keep the cold temperature steady to heal allies.

WidgetNode.Title: Thunderous Halberd
WidgetNode.Description: A halberd infused with the power of thunder. Great for burst damage, and its length makes it a great weapon for a variety of ranges.

WidgetNode.Title: Scythe of the Crow
WidgetNode.Description: A powerful scythe, great for both offense and defense. Able to instantly kill its target within a certain distance.

WidgetNode.Title: Chakram of the Seas
WidgetNode.Description: A round and sharp weapon that traveled the seas with its owner.

WidgetNode.Title: Dual EM Stars
WidgetNode.Description: These firearms are designed based on railguns, and must be used in a pair.

WidgetNode.Title: Molten Shield V2
WidgetNode.Description: A shield axe that belongs to the V2 weapon series, a collection of weapons forged with special techniques.

WidgetNode.Title: Venus
WidgetNode.Description: It's designer is unknown. The special hovering EM Blaster's prototype's blueprint has been lost. It contains a unique electrical savings process in its interior. It's extremely troublesome to repair when it gets worn out, but Cobalt-B of Banges Tech seems to be able to do it.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Elemental Suppression
PictureNodeArray.Description: All enemies have a weakness. Attacking each with the right element will deal more damage (For example: Volt attacks on enemies weak to the volt element will incur greater damage).

PictureNodeArray.Title: Weapon Element
PictureNodeArray.Description: Weapons have different elemental leanings, able to cause freeze, burn, electrify, and grievous effects.

MediaNode.Title: Defense Turret
MediaNode.Description: <jinse>Use turrets to hold off massive invasions.</>

PictureNodeArray.Title: Devourer
PictureNodeArray.Description: Originally a mild giant frog living in the bog, until Heirs of Aida modified it into a rampaging aberrant behemoth that's forever hunting food to satiate its bottomless belly.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Weapon Resonance
PictureNodeArray.Description: Equipping weapons to different slots causes resonance and grants different bonus effects.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Elementless Shield
PictureNodeArray.Description: This shield has no elemental resistance to reduce elemental damage. Use weapons that target the enemy's weak point.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Physical Shield
PictureNodeArray.Description: Green physical shields are much harder for physical attacks to shatter. Elemental weapons are recommended.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Pyroshield
PictureNodeArray.Description: Red pyroshields are much harder for fire attacks to shatter. Non-fire weapons are recommended.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Electroshield
PictureNodeArray.Description: Purple electroshields are much harder for volt attacks to shatter. Non-electricity weapons are recommended.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Frostshield
PictureNodeArray.Description: Blue frostshields are much harder for frost attacks to shatter. Non-frost weapons are recommended.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Multishield
PictureNodeArray.Description: Gold multishields are resistant to many elements. Use weapons matching target's weak point recommended.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Meryl
PictureNodeArray.Description: Unlock Rosy Edge to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Meryl, the weapon's Simulacrum.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Samir
PictureNodeArray.Description: Unlock Dual EM Stars to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Samir, the weapon's Simulacrum.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Huma
PictureNodeArray.Description: Unlock Molten Shield V2 to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Huma, the weapon's Simulacrum.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Shiro
PictureNodeArray.Description: Unlock Chakram of the Seas to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Shiro, the weapon's Simulacrum.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Cocoritter
PictureNodeArray.Description: Unlock Absolute Zero to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Cocoritter, the weapon's Simulacrum.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Zero
PictureNodeArray.Description: Unlock Negating Cube to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Zero, the weapon's Simulacrum.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Tsubasa
PictureNodeArray.Description: Unlock Icewind Arrow to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Tsubasa, the weapon's Simulacrum.

PictureNodeArray.Title: KING
PictureNodeArray.Description: Unlock Scythe of the Crow to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as KING, the weapon's Simulacrum.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Crow
PictureNodeArray.Description: Unlock Thunderblades to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Crow, the weapon's Simulacrum.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Echo
PictureNodeArray.Description: Unlock Thunderous Halberd to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Echo, the weapon's Simulacrum.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Ene
PictureNodeArray.Description: Unlock Pummeler to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Ene, the weapon's Simulacrum.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Hilda
PictureNodeArray.Description: Unlock the Terminator to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Hilda, the weapon's Simulacrum.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Bai Ling
PictureNodeArray.Description: Unlock Nightingale's Feather to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Bai Ling, the weapon's Simulacrum.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Pepper
PictureNodeArray.Description: Unlock Staff of Scars to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Pepper, the weapon's Simulacrum.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Nemesis
PictureNodeArray.Description: Unlock Venus to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Nemesis, the weapon's Simulacrum.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Greatsword
PictureNodeArray.Description: Instructions for greatswords. Learn how to use the skills for this type of weapon.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Long Spear
PictureNodeArray.Description: Instructions for long spears. Learn how to use the skills for this type of weapon.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Dual Blades
PictureNodeArray.Description: Instructions for dual blades. Learn how to use the skills for this type of weapon.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Bow
PictureNodeArray.Description: Instructions for bows. Learn how to use the skills for this type of weapon.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Staves
PictureNodeArray.Description: Instructions for staves. Learn how to use the skills for this type of weapon.

PictureNodeArray.Title: EM Blasters
PictureNodeArray.Description: Instructions for EM blasters. Learn how to use the skills for this type of weapon.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Mauls
PictureNodeArray.Description: Instructions for the Maul. Learn how to use the skills for this type of weapon.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Dual Pistols
PictureNodeArray.Description: Instructions for dual pistols. Learn how to use the skills for this type of weapon.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Scythe
PictureNodeArray.Description: Instructions for scythes. Learn how to use the skills for this type of weapon.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Chakram
PictureNodeArray.Description: Instructions for chakrams. Learn how to use the skills for this type of weapon.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Omnium
PictureNodeArray.Description: Instructions for Omnium weapons. Learn how to use the skills for this type of weapon.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Volt Ore
PictureNodeArray.Description: This marvel of nature has electrical properties. Use lightning weapons to deal damage to it.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Frost Ore
PictureNodeArray.Description: This marvel of nature has ice properties. Use frost weapons to deal damage to it.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Fire Ore
PictureNodeArray.Description: This marvel of nature has fire properties. Use flame weapons to deal damage to it.

WidgetNode.Title: Negating Cube
WidgetNode.Description: Users of the Enchanted Cube tend to think of many ways to negate unnecessary requirements.

WidgetNode.Title: Thunderblades
WidgetNode.Description: The latest Omnium dagger model in the pre-Cataclysm era, which features the most cutting-edge technologies back then. Very rare. Replicated according to the blueprint leaked to the public.

WidgetNode.Title: Icewind Arrow
WidgetNode.Description: The arrows from this bow carry the power of frost.

PictureNodeArray.Title: Spacerift
PictureNodeArray.Description: A loophole that occurs when space is not completely stable, going through the spacerift will result in transmission to a distant place.
